channel.title: Path and Classpath driving up an effing wall
channel.description: Hello, i have set up my class path variable and it works just fine. However, this is not the case with the Path variable. I erase whats in the path variable and put in: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin; then i go to command prompt and type in 'javac' and it works, but when i type in 'ipconfig' it doesnt work. So then i set it back to normal and 'javac' doesnt work but 'ipconfig' does. HELP[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2008, 10:44:37 PM[/size][hr]Help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2008, 11:33:23 PM[/size][hr]HELLLLLLLLP

item.title: Path and Classpath driving up an effing wall
item.dc:creator: @Monoxide Monoxide
item.description:
@Monoxide wrote:

Hello, i have set up my class path variable and it works just fine. However, this is not the case with the Path variable. I erase whats in the path variable and put in: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin; then i go to command prompt and type in ‘javac’ and it works, but when i type in ‘ipconfig’ it doesnt work. So then i set it back to normal and ‘javac’ doesnt work but ‘ipconfig’ does. HELP[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2008, 10:44:37 PM[/size][hr]Help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2008, 11:33:23 PM[/size][hr]HELLLLLLLLP

Read full topic
item.source: Path and Classpath driving up an effing wall
